This will give us more flexibility to make async calls to read/write vpd data.
Please rework the commit message to include a proper explanation.
Please check how we'd handle error responses from the D-Bus APIs we implement.
Please put the exit() back with success/failure as appropriate
either add a period instead of comma or rephrase it like "which keeps checking if an event happened and takes necessary action."
This is out of scope of this commit. So unless the body of the function is changed which changes the meaning of the function, I avoid changing committed parts.
nit: there is no use in holding reference to a shared pointer.
Why? Having reference will avoid incrementing reference count.
Well these are not out parameters, means I am not intending to return anything using these variables from this api.
Can you please remove reference to these variables.
this is included in manager.hpp. you can remove here
You meant ...connection.hpp or ...object_server.hpp as I dont see ...connection.hpp in manager.hpp
should you also remove server.cpp file from the repo?
Santosh: More generic statement required. Also add tested section.
BiosHandler is missing in boost commit
Match the function name case w.r.t PDI.
call back needs to be corrected.
Need not be a public api.

I think this should be (std::chrono::steady_clock::now() + std::chrono::seconds(5))

Given that we could take some finite time in lines 173 through 176, we should set the new timer from a time starting now.
For each of these D-Bus APIs, please check if we can now take parameters by (const) reference? In the past, we were tied to the signatures in the base class.
This looks pretty close to done now. Have you built an image out of this and run it through some IPLs (HW CI) before we can merge this?
looks fine from a high level
nit: shared pointer to bus connection
